zone.line: or music or architecture, any thing which
might bear a particular relation to their
own condition whilst it might bear a
general one to the universal constitution
of the world. But we judge from
partial evidence, & we judge perhaps
partially. Ennius, Varro, Pacuvius
& Accius, all great poets, have been lost.
Lucretius is in the highest, & Virgil
in a very high sense, a poet creator.
The chosen delicacy of the expressions of
the latter are as a mist of light which
conceal from us the intense & exceeding
truth of his conceptions of nature. Livy
is instinct with poetry. Horace, Catullus
Ovid, & generally the other great writers
of the Virgilian age, saw man & nature
in the mirror of Greece. The institutions
also & the religion of Rome were less
poetical than those of Greece, as the
shadow is less vivid than the substance.
Yet Poetry Hence Poetry in Rome
